text: Ethylpropyltryptamine (also known as N-ethyl-N-propyltryptamine or EPT) is a rarely encountered psychedelic substance from the tryptamine class, which makes it structurally related to DMT, MET, DET, and DPT. == Legal status == * United Kingdom: EPT is illegal in the United Kingdom as a result of the Psychoactive Substances Act of 2016.Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 (Legislation.gov.uk) |http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1971/38/schedule/2/part/I#reference- M_F_c7632653-ddad-4420-f307-e3da1e36d30e * United States: EPT may be considered an analogue of DMT, which is a Schedule I drug under the Controlled Substances Act. As such, the sale for human consumption would be illegal under the Federal Analogue Act. == References == == External links == * EPT (Isomer Design) Category:Tryptamines Category:Designer drugs
title: Ethylpropyltryptamine
